DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Studying sample blood laboratory patient high risk develop prostate cancer may help doctor identify biomarkers related cancer . PURPOSE : This research study look blood sample patient high risk develop prostate cancer healthy male participant .
DOC.brief_title: Study Blood Samples From Older Patients High Risk Developing Prostate Cancer From Healthy Male Participants
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To determine whether change pro-oxidant-antioxidant profile patient high risk develop prostate cancer . - To compare profile patient healthy control . OUTLINE : Participants undergo blood sample collection . Samples use measure level antioxidant enzyme ( i.e. , glutathione , glutathione peroxidase , glutathione reductase , superoxide dismutase , reduce glutathione ) biomarkers oxidative stress DNA damage leukocyte ( i.e. , thiobarbituric acid reactive substance [ TBARS ] 8-hydroxydeoxyguanosine ) . Samples analyze via antioxidant enzyme assay , TBARS assay , enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 40 participant ( 20 high risk develop prostate cancer 20 healthy control ) accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Meets 1 follow criterion : Patient high risk develop prostate cancer , due 1 follow risk factor : Histologically confirm proliferative inflammatory atrophy and/or highgrade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia lesion accompany chronic intraprostatic inflammation Abnormality observe digital rectal exam transrectal ultrasonography Continued elevate ageadjusted prostatespecific antigen ( PSA ) meeting least 1 follow criterion : Screening PSA > 4.0 ng/mL Free PSA < 18 % PSA velocity > 0.75 ng/mL within past year Healthy volunteer meeting follow criterion : Agematched Normal PSA level ( â‰¤ 2.1 ng/mL ) Normal digital rectal exam No prostatitis benign prostate hyperplasia No urinary symptom ( diagnose undiagnosed ) No diagnosis cancer PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Patients healthy control : No chronic inflammatory condition , especially regular use nonsteroidal antiinflammatory medication ( NSAIDs ) prescribed/recommended , include follow : Coronary heart disease Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) Psoriasis Pelvic inflammatory disease Multiple sclerosis Arthritis Lupus Hashimoto thyroiditis Inflammatory bowel disease ( i.e. , ulcerative colitis Crohn disease ) PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No prior radiotherapy surgery prostate ( healthy control )
